decision_conditions: The Council has considered your application and confirms that the proposals are acceptable as non-material amendments to the planning permission set out above. For the purposes of this decision, condition no. 14 will be removed and conditions no.2, no.5, no.7, no.8 and 13 of planning permission 22/04095/RE3 shall be replaced with the following condition(s): REPLACEMENT REPLACEMENT CONDITION 5:Planting plans complianceThe site shall be landscaped strictly in accordance with the approved details in drawings [8778-LDA00-XX-DR-L-3504-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3505-PL06, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3506-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3507-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3508-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3509-PL09, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3510-PL09, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3511-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DRL-3512-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3513-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3514-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3515-PL06, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3515-PL08] in the first planting season after completion, or earlier.Reason: In order to ensure landscaping is delivered in accordance with green infrastructure and biodiversity objectives.

REPLACEMENT CONDITION 7:Landscape management and monitoring planA landscape management plan, including long term design objectives, management responsibilities, monitoring methodologies and maintenance schedules for all landscape areas as identified within the hereby approved [8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3504-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3505-PL06, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3506-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3507-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3508-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3509-PL09, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3510-PL09, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3510-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3511-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3512-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3513-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3514-PL05, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3515-PL06, 8778-LDA-00-XX-DR-L-3515-PL08] shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the delivery of all permanent landscaping. The plan shall include an Invasive Species Control Plan, and management and monitoring of enhanced and newly created habitats will be required to ensure they establish as intended and in line with the SINC citation.The landscape management plan shall include details of how a 10% net gain in biodiversity will be achieved, in line with the Biodiversity Net Gain calculation [Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment Feb 2023] and as well as a plan to maintain the net gain for a minimum of 30 years after development completion.The site shall be managed and monitored strictly in accordance with the approved details beginning in the first planting season after completion of the development (or earlier).Reason: To ensure that the ecological value of the site is enhanced post development, and to comply with Policies CP30 and CP36 of the Core Strategy, Policies DMD37, DMD80 and DMD81 of the Development Management Document and Policies D4, D8, G4 and G5 of the London Plan.

REPLACEMENT CONDITION 8:LightingPrior to the first use of the development, lighting shall be installed in accordance with the hereby approved drawings [19119-MET-1300-HLG-DR-EO-004-03, 19119-MET-1300-HLG-DR-EO-002-B, 19119-MET-1300-HLG-DR-EO-003-B, 19119-MET-1300-HLG-DR-EO-004-B, 19119-MET-1300-HLGDR-EO-005-B,19119-MET-1300-DR-EO-009 C03, 19119-MET-1300-DR-EO-010 C02, 19119-MET-1300-HLG-DR-EO-008-B, 19119-MET-1300-HLG-DR-EO-009-B, 19119-MET-1300-HLG-DREO-010-B] and indicative specifications in [Lighting Asset Schedule ref. 19119-MET-HEL-DR-001 B, Proposed terminations and pillars ref. 19119-MET-HEL-DR-002 B, General Electrical details ref. 19119-MET-HEL-DR-003 B, Proposed Schematics ref. 19119-MET-HEL-DR-004 B]. The lighting shalloperate in accordance with these details, unless otherwise approved by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure lighting is installed and operates in a manner that minimises biodiversity impacts

REPLACEMENT CONDITION 13:Arboricultural Method Statement compliance Development shall be undertaken strictly in accordance with the approved details in the Arboricultural Report [Arboricultural Report, Arb Consultancy Rev 3 dated 11/03/2025].Reason: To ensure that the retained trees, shrubs and hedgerows on the site or in adjacent sites are not adversely affected by any aspect of the development, and to screen, preserve and enhance the development and ensure adequate landscape treatment in the interest of amenity, having regard to adopted Policy

street_name: Footpath From Mahon Close To Carterhatch Lane
description: Non-material amendment to ref: 22/04095/RE3 to allow alterations to the route of the path alongside the boundary with St Ignatius College to reduce gradients and insertion of an offshoot path to access benches and further landscaping and re-arrangement to the south of the Greenway.
